head.title: Attendant at Remote Gas Station Is Killled

hedline.hl1: Attendant at Remote Gas Station Is Killled

abstract.p: Joseph H Sass, attendant at service station in central New Jersey, is shot and killed by robber who flees scene in waiting van (S)

block.p: An attendant at a service station in a remote spot overlooking Interstate 78 in central New Jersey was shot and killed Thursday night by a robber, who then fled, the police said.

The attendant, Joseph H. Sass, was giving directions to a woman and her daughter at the King George Exxon Station in Bernards Township at 9:22 p.m., when a man approached on foot, robbed Mr. Sass and shot him once in the head, the police said.
An attendant at a service station in a remote spot overlooking Interstate 78 in central New Jersey was shot and killed Thursday night by a robber, who then fled, the police said.

The attendant, Joseph H. Sass, was giving directions to a woman and her daughter at the King George Exxon Station in Bernards Township at 9:22 p.m., when a man approached on foot, robbed Mr. Sass and shot him once in the head, the police said.
Mr. Sass, 31, of Phillipsburg, N.J., was pronounced dead at Morristown Memorial Hospital a short time later. The two women, and a mechanic who was inside doing repair work, were not hurt.
The station is just off a highway exit ramp in a heavily wooded area of Somerset County along King George Road, about a half-mile from its nearest neighbors.
Chief Thomas Kelly of the Bernards Township police, said Mr. Sass had worked at the station for 12 years.

The gunman had asked for change from a $5 bill, and while Mr. Sass was getting it, he took out a handgun, demanded money, placed the gun against the attendant's head and fired one shot, Chief Kelly said. He said the gunman then fled in a waiting van, which headed west toward Pennsylvania.
